intro: Atriplex halimoides var. conduplicata, commonly known as saltbush or shadscale, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a powdery coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in saline and alkaline soils, making it a common species in desert environments. Its ability to tolerate extreme drought and poor soil conditions makes it an important component of stabilizing desert ecosystems.
